comment.author: 35181773@N05
comment._content:
Glass negative. Fine image, seems some flare got through when transferring it unless it is from the original process. (The handwriting on the negative border says July 30, 1913, unless my eyes cannot see.) 

It is always interesting to browse here through history of photography and events at once.

comment.author: 38789304@N06
comment._content:
La toma es muy buena teniendo en cuenta, que el caballero
se encuentra andando, asì como el encuadre.Gracias por
el envio a mi correo.Saludos.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Anne Marie Simard:  Thank you for your appreciative comments and for catching the date on this image.  We will add the date information to the description when we reload the database.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Alfred Gwynne Vanderbilt I (October 20, 1877 – May 7, 1915) was a sportsman who died on the RMS Lusitania. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alfred_Gwynne_Vanderbilt_I The venue: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monmouth_County_Horse_Show

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Richard Arthur Norton:  Thank you for the information on Alfred Gwynne Vanderbilt.  We will add the fuller form of his name and dates to the description when we update the database.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to NYT of July 31, 1913, query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E0DE7DF123FE633A... A.G. VANDERBILT IN HORSE SHOW RING; Famous Exhibitor, However, Is Serving as Judge at Long Branch, N.J. "LONG BRANCH, July 30. -- Alfred G. Vanderbilt made the Monmouth County Horse Show, which opened here to-day, the medium of his first official actions in the matter of passing upon the merits of show horses in probably four years."
